info.description:
# Introduction
This documentation describes all the available MC APIs, which end-users can use for edge orchestration
info.title: Master Controller (MC) API Documentation

post.summary: Add a Cloudlet to the Auto Provisioning Policy.

post.description: Create definition for an application instance which will be deployed on a Cloudlet
Creates an instance of an App on a Cloudlet where it is defined by an App plus a ClusterInst key. Many of the fields here are inherited from the App definition
Sets up cloudlet services on Operators compute resources and makes it part of MobiledgeX edge resource portfolio. These resources will now be managed from edge controller

post.summary: Add a Cloudlet to a CloudletPool.

post.description: Creates an instance of a Cluster on a Cloudlet, defined by a Cluster Key and a Cloudlet Key.

post.summary: Create a code for an Operator.

post.description: Delete definition of an application instance. This requires that no application instance with this definition exists. If it exists, then user must delete those first
Deletes an instance of the App from the Cloudlet
Removes cloudlet services and will no longer be managed from edge controller

post.summary: Remove a Cloudlet from a CloudletPool.

post.description: Deletes an instance of Cluster deployed on a Cloudlet

post.summary: Delete a code for an Operator.
Discover if flavor produces a matching platform flavor.
Fetch a copy of the TagTable.

post.description: Refresh restarts an application instance with new App settings or image

post.summary: Remove a Cloudlet from the Auto Provisioning Policy.
Reset all settings to their defaults.
Run a Command or Shell on a container or VM.

post.description: Lists all application definitions managed from edge controller. Any fields specified will be used to filter results
Lists all the application instances managed by edge controller. Any fields specified will be used to filter results
Any fields specified will be used to filter results.
Any fields specified will be used to filter results.
Lists all the cloudlets managed from edge controller

post.summary: Show the Cloudlet to CloudletPool relationships.
Show Cloudlets that belong to the Pool.

post.description: Lists all the cluster instances managed by edge controller

post.summary: Show all Nodes connected to all Controllers.
Show CloudletPools that have Cloudlet as a member.

post.description: Any fields specified will be used to filter results.
Update definition of an application instance
Updates an application instance and then refreshes it
Updates cloudlet config and also manages upgrade of cloudlet services
Updates an instance of Cluster deployed on a Cloudlet
Create Organization to access operator/cloudlet APIs
Delete existing Organization
Show existing Organizations which user is authorized to access
API to update an existing Organization
Delete existing user
Show existing users which user is authorized to access
Login to MC
If login password is lost or to be changed, this API will reset the login password
Create a new user who can access/manage resources

annotations.description: Annotations are extra information about the alert

notify_id.description: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

App.description: App belongs to developers and is used to provide information about their application.
App.title: Application

access_ports.description:
Comma separated list of protocol:port pairs that the App listens on.
Numerical values must be decimal format.
i.e. tcp:80,udp:10002,http:443

android_package_name.description: Android package name used to match the App name from the Android package

annotations.description: Annotations is a comma separated map of arbitrary key value pairs,

command.description: Command that the container runs to start service

configs.description: Customization files passed through to implementing services

default_shared_volume_size.description: shared volume size when creating auto cluster

deployment_generator.description: Deployment generator target to generate a basic deployment manifest

deployment_manifest.description:
Deployment manifest is the deployment specific manifest file/config
For docker deployment, this can be a docker-compose or docker run file
For kubernetes deployment, this can be a kubernetes yaml or helm chart file

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

internal_ports.description: Should this app have access to outside world?

md5sum.description: MD5Sum of the VM-based app image

official_fqdn.description: Official FQDN is the FQDN that the app uses to connect by default

revision.description: Revision increments each time the App is updated

scale_with_cluster.description: Option to run App on all nodes of the cluster

AppInst.description:
AppInst is an instance of an App on a Cloudlet where it is defined by an App plus a ClusterInst key.
Many of the fields here are inherited from the App definition.
AppInst.title: Application Instance

configs.description: Customization files passed through to implementing services

errors.description: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the AppInst on the Cloudlet

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

force_update.description: Force Appinst refresh even if revision number matches App revision number.

mapped_ports.description:
For instances accessible via a shared load balancer, defines the external
ports on the shared load balancer that map to the internal ports
External ports should be appended to the Uri for L4 access.

revision.description: Revision increments each time the App is updated.  Updating the App Instance will sync the revision with that of the App

shared_volume_size.description: shared volume size when creating auto cluster

update_multiple.description: Allow multiple instances to be updated at once

uri.description: Base FQDN (not really URI) for the App. See Service FQDN for endpoint access.

AppInstKey.description: AppInstKey uniquely identifies an Application Instance (AppInst) or Application Instance state (AppInstInfo).
AppInstKey.title: App Instance Unique Key

AppPort.description: AppPort describes an L4 or L7 public access port/path mapping. This is used to track external to internal mappings for access via a shared load balancer or reverse proxy.
AppPort.title: Application Port

end_port.description: A non-zero end port indicates a port range from internal port to end port, inclusive.

fqdn_prefix.description: FQDN prefix to append to base FQDN in FindCloudlet response. May be empty.

path_prefix.description: Public facing path for HTTP L7 access.

public_port.description: Public facing port for TCP/UDP (may be mapped on shared LB reverse proxy)

IdentityToken.description: An opaque token used to authenticate a user after a successful login

AutoProvCloudlet.description: AutoProvCloudlet stores the potential cloudlet and location for DME lookup

AutoProvPolicy.description: AutoProvPolicy defines the automated provisioning policy

deploy_client_count.description: Minimum number of clients within the auto deploy interval to trigger deployment

deploy_interval_count.description: Number of intervals to check before triggering deployment

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

AutoProvPolicyCloudlet.description: AutoProvPolicyCloudlet is used to add and remove Cloudlets from the Auto Provisioning Policy

AutoScalePolicy.description:
AutoScalePolicy defines when and how ClusterInsts will have their
nodes scaled up or down.

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

trigger_time_sec.description: Trigger time defines how long trigger threshold must be satified in seconds before acting upon it.

CRMOverride.description:
CRMOverride can be applied to commands that issue requests to the CRM.
It should only be used by administrators when bugs have caused the
Controller and CRM to get out of sync. It allows commands from the
Controller to ignore errors from the CRM, or ignore the CRM completely
(messages will not be sent to CRM).
CRMOverride.title: Overrides default CRM behaviour

Cloudlet.description: A Cloudlet is a set of compute resources at a particular location, provided by an Operator.
Cloudlet.title: Cloudlet

env_var.description: Single Key-Value pair of env var to be passed to CRM

errors.description: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the Cloudlet.

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

notify_srv_addr.description: Address for the CRM notify listener to run on

num_dynamic_ips.description: Number of dynamic IPs available for dynamic IP support

res_tag_map.description: Optional resource to restagtbl key map key values = [gpu, nas, nic]

static_ips.description: List of static IPs for static IP support

CloudletInfo.title: CloudletInfo provides information from the Cloudlet Resource Manager about the state of the Cloudlet.

errors.description: Any errors encountered while making changes to the Cloudlet

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

notify_id.description: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

os_max_ram.description: Maximum Ram in MB on the Cloudlet

os_max_vcores.description: Maximum number of VCPU cores on the Cloudlet

os_max_vol_gb.description: Maximum amount of disk in GB on the Cloudlet

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

CloudletRefs.title: CloudletRefs track used resources and Clusters instantiated on a Cloudlet. Used resources are compared against max resources for a Cloudlet to determine if resources are available for a new Cluster to be instantiated on the Cloudlet.

root_lb_ports.description:
Used ports on root load balancer. Map key is public port, value is a bitmap for the protocol
bitmap: bit 0: tcp, bit 1: udp

CloudletResMap.description: optional resource input consists of a resource specifier and clouldkey name

CloudletState.title: CloudletState is the state of the Cloudlet.

ClusterInst.description:
ClusterInst is an instance of a Cluster on a Cloudlet.
It is defined by a Cluster, Cloudlet, and Developer key.
ClusterInst.title: Cluster Instance

auto.description: Auto is set to true when automatically created by back-end (internal use only)

errors.description: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the ClusterInst on the Cloudlet.

external_volume_size.description: Size of external volume to be attached to nodes.  This is for the root partition

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

image_name.description: Optional resource specific image to launch

num_masters.description: Number of k8s masters (In case of docker deployment, this field is not required)

num_nodes.description: Number of k8s nodes (In case of docker deployment, this field is not required)

reserved_by.description: For reservable MobiledgeX ClusterInsts, the current developer tenant

shared_volume_size.description: Size of an optional shared volume to be mounted on the master

ClusterInstKey.description: ClusterInstKey uniquely identifies a Cluster Instance (ClusterInst) or Cluster Instance state (ClusterInstInfo).
ClusterInstKey.title: Cluster Instance unique key

developer.description: Name of Developer that this cluster belongs to

ClusterRefs.title: ClusterRefs track used resources within a ClusterInst. Each AppInst specifies a set of required resources (Flavor), so tracking resources used by Apps within a Cluster is necessary to determine if enough resources are available for another AppInst to be instantiated on a ClusterInst.

apps.description: Apps instances in the Cluster Instance

config.description: config file contents or URI reference

kind.description: kind (type) of config, i.e. k8s-manifest, helm-values, deploygen-config

ContainerChangeResponseItem.description: ContainerChangeResponseItem change item in response to ContainerChanges operation

Path.description: Path to file that has changed

ContainerCreateCreatedBody.description: ContainerCreateCreatedBody OK response to ContainerCreate operation

Id.description: The ID of the created container

Warnings.description: Warnings encountered when creating the container

ContainerTopOKBody.description: ContainerTopOKBody OK response to ContainerTop operation

Processes.description: Each process running in the container, where each is process is an array of values corresponding to the titles

ContainerUpdateOKBody.description: ContainerUpdateOKBody OK response to ContainerUpdate operation

ContainerWaitOKBody.description: ContainerWaitOKBody OK response to ContainerWait operation

ContainerWaitOKBodyError.description: ContainerWaitOKBodyError container waiting error, if any

Name.description: User name. Can only contain letters, digits, underscore, period, hyphen. It cannot have leading or trailing spaces or period. It cannot start with hyphen

DeleteType.description: DeleteType specifies if AppInst can be auto deleted or not
DeleteType.title: DeleteType

name.description: Organization or Company Name that a Developer is part of

EmailRequest.description:
Email request is used for password reset and to resend welcome
verification email. It contains the information need to send
some kind of email to the user.

callbackurl.description: Callback URL to verify user email

container_id.description: ContainerID is the name of the target container, if applicable

Flavor.description:
To put it simply, a flavor is an available hardware configuration for a server.
It defines the size of a virtual server that can be launched.
Flavor.title: Flavors define the compute, memory, and storage capacity of computing instances.

disk.description: Amount of disk space in gigabytes

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

opt_res_map.description:
Optional Resources request, key = [gpu, nas, nic] gpu kinds: [gpu, vgpu, pci]
form: $resource=$kind:[$alias]$count ex: optresmap=gpu=vgpus:nvidia-63:1

disk.description: Amount of disk in GB on the Cloudlet

name.description: Name of the flavor on the Cloudlet

ram.description: Ram in MB on the Cloudlet

vcpus.description: Number of VCPU cores on the Cloudlet

HealthCheck.description: Health check status gets set by external, or rootLB health check
HealthCheck.title: Health check status

ImageType.description: ImageType specifies image type of an App
ImageType.title: ImageType

IpAccess.description: IpAccess indicates the type of RootLB that Developer requires for their App
IpAccess.title: IpAccess Options

IpSupport.description: Static IP support indicates a set of static public IPs are available for use, and managed by the Controller. Dynamic indicates the Cloudlet uses a DHCP server to provide public IP addresses, and the controller has no control over which IPs are assigned.
IpSupport.title: Type of public IP support

LProto.title: LProto indicates which protocol to use for accessing an application on a particular port. This is required by Kubernetes for port mapping.

Liveness.description: Liveness indicates if an object was created statically via an external API call, or dynamically via an internal algorithm.
Liveness.title: Liveness Options

altitude.description:
On android only lat and long are guaranteed to be supplied
altitude in meters

course.description: course (IOS) / bearing (Android) (degrees east relative to true north)

Node.title: Node defines a DME (distributed matching engine) or CRM (cloudlet resource manager) instance.

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

notify_id.description: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

NodeKey.description: NodeKey uniquely identifies a DME or CRM node

NodeType.description: NodeType defines the type of Node

OperationTimeLimits.description: Time limits for cloudlet create, update and delete operations
OperationTimeLimits.title: Operation time limits

OperatorCode.description: OperatorCode maps a carrier code to an Operator name

code.description: MCC plus MNC code, or custom carrier code designation.

name.description: Company or Organization name of the operator

Name.description: Organization name. Can only contain letters, digits, underscore, period, hyphen. It cannot have leading or trailing spaces or period. It cannot start with hyphen

port_range_max.description: TCP or UDP port range end

port_range_min.description: TCP or UDP port range start

PlatformConfig.description: Platform specific configuration required for Cloudlet management
PlatformConfig.title: Platform Configuration

notify_ctrl_addrs.description: Address of controller notify port (can be multiple of these)

registry_path.description: Path to Docker registry holding edge-cloud image

PlatformType.description: PlatformType is the supported list of cloudlet types
PlatformType.title: Platform Type

developer.description: Name of the Developer that this policy belongs to

PrivacyPolicy.description:
PrivacyPolicy defines security restrictions for cluster instances
nodes scaled up or down.

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

outbound_security_rules.description: list of outbound security rules for whitelisting traffic

azone.description: availability zone(s) of resource if required

auto_deploy_interval_sec.description: Auto Provisioning Stats push and analysis interval (seconds)

auto_deploy_max_intervals.description: Auto Provisioning Policy max allowed intervals

auto_deploy_offset_sec.description: Auto Provisioning analysis offset from interval (seconds)

fields.description: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

shepherd_health_check_retries.description: Number of times Shepherd Health Check fails before we mark appInst down

StatusInfo.description:
Used to track status of create/delete/update for resources that are being modified
by the controller via the CRM.  Tasks are the high level jobs that are to be completed.
Steps are work items within a task. Within the clusterinst and appinst objects this
is converted to a string
StatusInfo.title: Status Information

Timestamp.description:
This is a simple Timestamp message type
grpc-gateway converts google.protobuf.Timestamp into an RFC3339-type string
which is a waste of a conversion, so we define our own

TrackedState.description:
TrackedState is used to track the state of an object on a remote node,
i.e. track the state of a ClusterInst object on the CRM (Cloudlet).
TrackedState.title: Tracked States

Name.description: User name. Can only contain letters, digits, underscore, period, hyphen. It cannot have leading or trailing spaces or period. It cannot start with hyphen

Bearer.description: Use [login API](#operation/Login) to generate bearer token (JWT) for authorization. Usage format - `Bearer <JWT>`
Bearer.name: Authorization

tags.description: Authentication is done by a user name or email plus a password. The login function returns a JSON Web Token (JWT) once authenticated, that should be included with subsequent API calls to authenticate the user. The JWT will expire after a while for security, at which point you may need to log in again
tags.name: Security

tags.description: Users can be assigned roles for Organizations, allowing them to view or manage resources associated with the Organizations
tags.name: User

tags.description: Organizations group a set of resources together, for example Apps, App Instances, or Cloudlets. Users given a role in an Organization can operate on those resources in the scope provided by their role
tags.name: Organization

tags.description: Cloudlet is a set of compute resources at a particular location, provided by an Operator
tags.name: Cloudlet

tags.description: ClusterInst is an instance of a Cluster on a Cloudlet. It is defined by a Cluster, Cloudlet, and Developer key
tags.name: ClusterInst

tags.description: App belongs to developers and is used to provide information about their application
tags.name: App

tags.description: AppInst is an instance of an App on a Cloudlet where it is defined by an App plus a ClusterInst key
tags.name: AppInst
